ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Maximum_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Maximum_tolerance_characteristic indicates the maximum allowed value for the parameter specified.

the items specifies the role of the for the Maximum_tolerance_characteristic. There is exactly one for each items. The items specifies the maximum value of the for the Maximum_tolerance_characteristic.

A Measure_qualification is a mean to provide information about measurements in which there is an associated uncertainty. The uncertainty may be specified as precision, qualitative uncertainty, or expanded uncertainty, and the type of the related datum shall be included. The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
the qualifiers specifies the for the Measure_qualification. There shall be one or more for each qualifiers.
the qualified_measure specifies the for the Measure_qualification.
the description specifies the string that provides additional human-interpretable information for the Measure_qualification.
the name specifies the string that serves to identify the Measure_qualification.
A Minimum_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Minimum_tolerance_characteristic indicates the minimum allowed value for the parameter specified.

the items specifies the role of the for the Minimum_tolerance_characteristic. There shall be exactly one for a items. The items specifies the minimum value of the for the Minimum_tolerance_characteristic.

A Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic includes a minimum, maximum, and nominal characteristic numeric parameter. All three have the same base unit, but may have different prefixes.

the items specifies the nominal, minimum, and maximum values of the for the Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic. There shall be one nominal, one minimum and one maximum value for the Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic.
A Statistical_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Statistical_tolerance_characteristic supports the exchange of properties defined by statistical distributions.

ext_description.p: A Symmetrical_tolerance_characteristic is a type of that has symmetrical tolerances around the nominal value. The structure is a nominal value with a ratio. The ratio is applied to the nominal value and applies to both plus and minus.
ext_description.note: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS.
ext_description.example: A resistance of 22 Ohm plus or minus 10% would be represented with two values, 22 Ohm and .10 since the same quantity 10% is referenced on both sides of the nominal value.
ext_description.note: An unsymmetrical distribution would be represented with a member of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the items specifies the value of the for the Symmetrical_tolerance_characteristic. There shall be exactly two for the Symmetrical_tolerance_characteristic.

the range_type specifies the classification of the Range_characteristic. The Range_characteristic shall be open, closed, lower_open or upper_open.
